newsitem.title: JAPAN: Sony to join News Corp's broadcast venture - paper.
newsitem.headline: Sony to join News Corp's broadcast venture - paper.

text.p: Japanese entertainment giant Sony Corp plans to enter the broadcasting business by taking a stake in News Corp's Japanese satellite broadcasting venture, Japan's leading financial daily reported on Friday.
Japan Sky Broadcasting Co, or JSkyB, is currently owned by News Corp and Japan's Softbank Corp, a computer software and publishing firm.
Sony president Nobuyuki Idei has proposed that the three firms take equal stakes in the digital satellite broadcaster, the Nihon Keizai Shimbun said.
Sony officials said they could not immediately comment on the report.

Sony will set up a company in March with its units Sony Pictures Entertainment (Japan) Inc and Sony Music Entertainment (Japan) Inc to provide programming and production equipment to JSkyB, the paper said.
An agreement in principle was reached during a "secret" visit to Japan earlier this month by News Corp president Rupert Murdoch, it said.
JSkyB was launched in December and will be one of several multichannel satellite broadcasters vying for viewers in Japan.
